comment.author: 42264328@N00
comment._content: Harry Bingham Brown (1883-1954), aviator, see Early Aviators. That site has the same photo. Edit: A NY Times article for 6 November 1912 discusses an aviation meet in New York, where Brown set a record. Another New York meet with Brown is mentioned in this article from 3 October 1913.

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: We'll add his middle name to the source data and reload the description.

comment.author: 68439219@N06
comment._content:
Harold H. Brown   Aero Club of America Pilot # 58  September 7, 1911  Nassau Boulevard Aerodrome, Garden City, Long Island , New York . He was a pupil of the Wright school at Nassau Boulevard. 
Brown, prior to his arrival back in US, had obtained Royal Aero Club Pilot # 109  August 1,  1911   Farman biplane Brooklands
